nodes.text: Yennir of the Green was a soldier in the Republic Army during the Galactic War between the Galactic Republic and the resurgent Sith Empire. In 3640 BBY, Yennir was assigned to Sergeant Shanra Immel's squad and served with Republic Special Forces Division Colonel Jace Malcom during the battle of Kalandis Seven, in which Yennir and the squad were ordered to destroy the local spaceport. Yennir and the rest of the squad made it to the spaceport, planted their targeting beacons, and shortly after, their target was destroyed.

In 3640 BBY, during the Galactic War between the Galactic Republic and the resurgent Sith Empire, Yennir of the Green served as a soldier in the Republic Army. Yennir was assigned to Sergeant Shanra Immel's squad and fought alongside SpecForce Colonel Jace Malcom in a battle on Kalandis Seven, a desolate Inner Rim planet covered in fog. During the battle, Yennir and the squad were tasked with the destruction of the local Imperial-controlled spaceport. On the way to their target, Yennir and the squad were attacked, and Corporal Amden vor Keioidian was fatally wounded. Yennir's sergeant activated Keioidian's med tracer before ordering the squad to move out and leave Keioidian behind.

Three hours later, Yennir and the squad finally reached their objective and started planting targeting beacons, which would allow Republic starfighters to destroy the spaceport regardless of the fog. Shortly after Yennir and the squad planted the last of the beacons, the fighters destroyed the spaceport.
Yennir of the Green had good eyes that could see through fog as if it were glass.

Yennir of the Green first appeared, albeit voice only, in Alexander Freed's short story The Last Battle of Colonel Jace Malcom, which was published within Star Wars Insider 137 and released on October 23, 2012.
